title: Electroporation of Agrobacterium

source.description: Get aliquotted electrocompetent Agrobacteria from -80°C freezer

source.title: Making electrocompetent Agrobacterium tumefaciens

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"94q5c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cpga1","text":"LB medium (for 1 litre combine 10 g Tryptone, 5 g Yeast Extrad and 10 g NaCl, adjust pH to 7.0 and autoclave)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c0jgs","text":"10% glycerol solution (ice cold)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7l31a","text":"H2O (ice cold)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6jot","text":"liquid nitrogen","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"90qnd","text":"50 - 60 x 1.5 ml tubes (pre-chill in fridge)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6f27v","text":"10 ml pipette tips","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bt672","text":"8 x 50 ml tubes (pre-chill in fridge)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e51nv","text":"Your favourite strain of Agrobacterium tumefaciens grown on a plate","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":25,"length":25,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6eqmn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bq1ln","text":"Depending on your strain of Agrobacterium you'll need the following antibiotics:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"rmcd","text":"AGL1: rifampicin 100 ng\/ul","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":4,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8nh0a","text":"LBA 4404: rifampicin 100 ng\/ul, streptomycin 100 ng\/ul --> grows slow and clumps","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":8,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cqgpa","text":"GV3101::pMP90: rifampicin 100 ng\/ul, gentamicin 25 ng\/ul --> grows fastest of the three","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":13,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"8632CD602DCE11E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A","id":707041,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Things you need to prepare"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3fa3b","text":"Inoculate 3 ml LB (containing the appropriate antibiotics) with 1 colony of Agrobacterium tumefaciens in the morning and incubate at 28\u00b0C at 250 rpm for the rest of the day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":9,"length":8,"style":"bold"},{"offset":64,"length":37,"style":"bold"},{"offset":133,"length":16,"style":"bold"},{"offset":76,"length":25,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"83skr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7s5tt","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"29rr4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"56f20","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":2}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"7D64C9502DD211E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A","temperature":"28","unit":10,"label":"","step_guid":"560418A02DCF11E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A"}},{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"FD5307D02DD211E98A1C579A8218D81F","amount":"3","unit":2,"label":"LB","step_guid":"560418A02DCF11E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A"}},{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"9F2912202E6E11E982679F36EEF28C3E","duration":18000,"label":"","step_guid":"560418A02DCF11E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A","start":null,"pause":null}}],"guid":"560418A02DCF11E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A","id":707042,"previous_id":707041,"previous_guid":"8632CD602DCE11E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A","section":"Day 1"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4b2bi","text":"In the evening inoculate 3 x 150 ml LB (containing the appropriate antibiotics) with 1 ml each of the culture grown throuout the day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":25,"length":13,"style":"bold"},{"offset":85,"length":24,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cra56","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"h5n0","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"krvq","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"7D64C9502DD211E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A","temperature":"28","unit":10,"label":"","step_guid":"560418A02DCF11E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A"}},{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"FD5307D02DD211E98A1C579A8218D81F","amount":"450","unit":2,"label":"LB","step_guid":"560418A02DCF11E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A"}}],"guid":"8F7AF1302DCF11E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A","id":707043,"previous_id":707042,"previous_guid":"560418A02DCF11E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A","section":"Day 1"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mm","text":"Incubate at 28\u00b0C at 250 rpm until OD600 reaches 0.8 - 1.0 (This usually takes around 30 - 40 hours).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":12,"length":15,"style":"bold"},{"offset":34,"length":23,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9ktok","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bpbbm","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"b1ror","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"7D64C9502DD211E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A","temperature":"28","unit":10,"label":"","step_guid":"560418A02DCF11E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A"}},{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"CA97B4C02DD311E99EC699B4110253F7","duration":108000,"label":"","step_guid":"13BC84402DD011E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A","start":null,"pause":null}}],"guid":"13BC84402DD011E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A","id":707044,"previous_id":707043,"previous_guid":"8F7AF1302DCF11E9BABA25A5C84BCF1A","section":"Day 1"}

source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ojgv","text":"This protocol yields about 5 ml of electrocompetent Agrobacterium tumefaciens cells, aliquotted into 80 ul you get 50-60 tubes out of it.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":52,"length":26,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11r7r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpk1s","text":"Rifampicin is dark red and the colour will change over time, it does however NOT interfere with OD600 measurements, so you can use LB to blank. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fgbc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
add 0.1 - 0.5 µl plasmid to 80 µl Agro aliquot
mix gently and transfer into 1 mm electroporation cuvette
select Agrobacterium program on electroporator (check manufacturers handbook) and deliver pulse
flush cuvette with 500 µl SOC medium and transfer back to 1.5 ml tube
incubate at 28°C at 280 rpm for 3-4 hours
transfer 20 µl into new 1.5 ml tube
plate 20 µl of SOC diluted Agro onto YM plates containing the correct antibiotics for your strain of Agrobacterium plus an antibiotic to select for your plasmid.
incubate at 28°C for 2-3 days until colonies become visible

Media:
  • YM plates (For 1 litre: 10 g Mannitol, 0.4 g Yeast Extract, 0.5 g K2HPO4, 0.1 g NaCl, 0.2 g MgSO4 7H2O, 15 g Agar) --> autoclave and add appropriate antibiotics before making plates.
  • SOB (For 1 litre: 0.5 g NaCl, 20 g Tryptone, 5 g Yeast Extract) --> autoclave
  • 2M Glucose solution (For 50 ml: 18 g Glucose) --> filter sterilize
  • SOC (For 100 ml: 99 ml SOB, 1 ml 2M glucose solution)
  • Antibiotics:
  • AGL1: rifampicin 100 ng/ul
  • LBA 4404: rifampicin 100 ng/ul, streptomycin 100 ng/ul --> grows slow and clumps
  • GV3101::pMP90: rifampicin 100 ng/ul, gentamicin 25 ng/ul --> grows fastest of the three
Antibiotics:
  • AGL1: rifampicin 100 ng/ul
  • LBA 4404: rifampicin 100 ng/ul, streptomycin 100 ng/ul --> grows slow and clumps
  • GV3101::pMP90: rifampicin 100 ng/ul, gentamicin 25 ng/ul --> grows fastest of the three

description: A quick guide on how to electroporate your plasmid of interest into electrocompetent Agrobacterium tumefaciens cells.
